no.geosoft.jwlf

Class Formatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.geosoft.jwlf.Formatter

  • public final class Formatter
extends Object
    A class capable of formatting (i.e write as text) numbers so that they get uniform appearance and can be presented together, typically in a column with decimal symbol aligned etc.
    Author:
    Jacob Dreyer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Formatter()
      Create a default number formatter,

    • Constructor Detail

      • Formatter

        public Formatter(double[] values,
                 Integer nSignificantDigits,
                 Integer nDecimals,
                 Locale locale)
        Create a common formatter for the specified set of numbers.
        Parameters:
        values - Representative values to use for creating the formatter. Null to create a generic formatter independent of any actual values.
        nSignificantDigits - Number of significant digits. Defaults to 7 if null. Ignored if nDecimals is specified.
        nDecimals - Number of decimals. If null, decide by significan digits.
        locale - Locale to present numbers in. Null for default.

      • Formatter

        public Formatter(double[] values)
        Create a common formatter for the specified set of numbers.
        Parameters:
        values - Representative values to use for creating the formatter. Null to create a generic formatter independent of any actual values.

    • Method Detail

      • countDigits

        public static int countDigits(long v)
        Return the number of digits in the specified number. NOTE: This method is a copy from cc.util.NumberUtil and should be kept in sync with that one.
        Parameters:
        v - Number to count digits in.
        Returns:
        Number of digits in v. [1,>.

      • format

        public String format(double value)
        Format the specified value according to the formatting defined by this formatter.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to format,
        Returns:
        Text representation of the value according to the format.

      • getFormat

        public DecimalFormat getFormat()
        Return the back-end decimal format of this formatter.
        Returns:
        The back-end decimal format of this formatter. Never null.
